wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Hart-Davies (1849 – 3 January 1920) was a British colonial administrator and Liberal politician.

response: Politically, Bousfield was a Conservative, and stood unsuccessfully twice for election as Member of Parliament for Mid Lanarkshire in the 1880s. He entered the Commons at a By-election at Hackney North in May 1892. He held the seat at the 1895 and 1900 elections, before being unseated by Thomas Hart-Davies, when the Liberals swept to power at the 1906 general election. He did not stand for election again.
